title: Do you use cryptocurrencies?
content: We use blockchain as a distributed transaction storage system and do not work with cryptocurrency. However, when building individual clusters, you can use its currency for instance, to arrange billing.

title: What are the main differences between sandbox and production environment?
content: Sandbox with pre-set three nodes environment and APIs is great for rapid prototyping and debugging of integration processes without setting up your own environment. In production environment you will have your own environment set up for your specific needs. You can host your infrastructure or use our commercial infrastructure hosting and support services.

title: What types of authorization are used in Kekker Sandbox?
content: For simplicity we use Basic authorization for Sandbox. Production environment is usually deployed in a closed loop system.

title: I created a Deal on my node. How do the Dealâ€™s other members learn about this?
content: An event mechanism is used to track changes in transactions.

title: What are controlled and uncontrolled Deals?
content: Controlled Deals are the main type of transactions in the system. It's kind and the transition map is set up and published by the cluster administrator. If a member who is not a cluster administrator needs a new Deal type with with specific transition map he should request the cluster administrator for publication of such transition map template. Uncontrolled Deals are used when the state transition map is not known in advance.

title: Are there any differences between the sandbox and production environments?
content: No, except there is no authentication in the production environment as it is assumed it is a safe environment and the authentification is not required. If necessary, you can use any proxy with authentication.

title: Is it possible to transfer a deal from one channel (Channel header in requests) to another?
content: Yes, in the production environment it is possible to use one common channel for all transactions and differentiation at the "business application" level. This is not possible in the Sandbox as the channel is designed to differentiate transactions by "business applications" and is not used by the platform.

title: POST/API/DEALS: "Parent" - how to use it in more detail? I tried dealId and localDealId and it didn't work out.
content: "Parent" - the global or local identifier of the linked deal.

title: POST/API/DEALS: "AppRef" - no matter whether I specify it when creating it or not, in the created deal it is filled with UUID.
content: "AppRef" is a custom unique identifier for the deal. If not specified by "business application" when creating a deal, it is filled in with the GUID [work in progress]

title: POST/API/DEALS: "History" - is it possible to display the history of parameters and files changes?
content: Yes, this is technically possible. So far there were no requirements for this functionality, however we will look into this if there is a demand.
